poem:
Title: "The Vessel and the Gene"

In the sterile cavern of Gosh,
a breakthrough. A dancing gene, sequenced
for the children of bubbles. Life's whisper. 

Yet, retreating, the pharmaceutical shade
abandons the holy art.
To cure, but not be covered in gold-
a disheartening reality. 

Purity, they say,
cannot pay for the miracle.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Great Ormond Street hoping to license gene therapy for ‘bubble baby’ syndrome When Great Ormond Street hospital (Gosh) published the results of its gene therapy trial for “bubble baby” syndrome it was hailed as a medical breakthrough. The treatment had a more than 95% success rate for treating the life-threatening disorder in which children have no immune system. But less than a year later, the therapy had been dropped by the pharmaceutical company that planned". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
